title: Prompt Engineering
description: Master the art of crafting effective prompts for AI models

options.text: Writing code to fix AI bugs
Crafting instructions to guide AI model outputs
Designing user interfaces for AI apps

questions.explanation: Prompt engineering is the practice of designing and optimizing input prompts to get desired outputs from AI models.
questions.conceptExplanation: Prompt engineering involves crafting clear, specific instructions that help AI models understand exactly what you want. Good prompts include context, examples, and clear formatting instructions.

questions.text: Which technique involves showing the model examples of desired output format?
questions.explanation: Few-shot prompting provides examples of input-output pairs to teach the model the desired format or reasoning pattern.
questions.conceptExplanation: Few-shot prompting is a technique where you include several examples (shots) of the task in your prompt. This helps the model understand the pattern and produce similar outputs for new inputs.

questions.text: What does the 'temperature' parameter control in LLMs?
questions.explanation: Temperature controls the randomness of the model's output. Lower values (0.1) are more deterministic; higher values (0.9) are more creative.
questions.conceptExplanation: Temperature is a hyperparameter that controls the probability distribution over tokens. Lower temperatures make the model more conservative and predictable, while higher temperatures encourage diverse and creative outputs.

options.text: Connecting multiple AI models in sequence
Prompting the model to show its reasoning step-by-step
Sending prompts through multiple API calls

questions.explanation: Chain-of-thought prompting encourages the model to break down complex problems into intermediate reasoning steps.
questions.conceptExplanation: Chain-of-thought prompting is a technique where you explicitly ask the model to think step by step or show its work. This improves performance on complex reasoning tasks like math problems or logical puzzles.

questions.text: Which is a best practice for system prompts?

options.text: Make them as vague as possible
Include clear role definition and constraints
Change them randomly for each request

questions.explanation: System prompts should clearly define the AI's role, capabilities, and constraints to guide consistent behavior.
questions.conceptExplanation: System prompts set the foundation for how an AI should behave throughout a conversation. They define the persona, tone, and boundaries. Good system prompts are specific, consistent, and aligned with the intended use case.
